overview: Caught live in Salt Lake City on their 2000 tour supporting the New Tattoo album, Motley Crüe's first concert video is a must for Crüe fanatics. Even without trouble-plagued drummer Tommy Lee (in his place, Hole's Samantha Maloney powerfully beats the skins), the Crüe sizzles through a 95-minute set of headbanging anthems like "Kickstart My Heart," "Dr. Feelgood," and "Shout at the Devil." Even a raucous cover version of "White Punk on Dope" fits snugly into the Crüe's sound, with Vince Neil's vocals, Mick Mars's guitar, and Nikki Sixx's bass playing all in fine fettle.  Track Listing:  01. Kickstart My Heart,  02. Same Ol’ Situation  03. Primal Scream  04. Punched in the Teeth By Love  05. Dr. Feelgood  06. Home Sweet Home  07. Don’t Go Away Mad (Just Go Away)  08. Piece of Your Action  09. Wild Side  10. Hell on High Heels  11. Looks That Kill  12. Girls, Girls, Girls  13. Live Wire  14. White Punks on Dope  15. Shout at the Devil
title: Mötley Crüe: Lewd, Crued & Tattooed
